architecture

Class LevelEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • architecture.LevelEngine

  • public class LevelEngine
extends java.lang.Object

    LevelEngine

    This class contains all the data for each level setup. Uses legacy code from school project.
    Since:
    2017-10-31
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Mark Baldwin, Cyndi Rader, Adam Nelson

      void levelFour()
      Level Four is the final level and the second boss level.
      void levelOne()
      Level One is a simple level where the player explores the basic mechanics of the game.
      void levelThree()
      Level Three is the first boss level where the player must attack an enemy to advance rather than avoiding them.
      void levelTwo()
      Level Two is more difficult, offering multiple opportunities for the player to advance but also posing more danger.

      • levelOne

        public void levelOne()
        Level One is a simple level where the player explores the basic mechanics of the game.

      • levelTwo

        public void levelTwo()
        Level Two is more difficult, offering multiple opportunities for the player to advance but also posing more danger.

      • levelThree

        public void levelThree()
        Level Three is the first boss level where the player must attack an enemy to advance rather than avoiding them.

      • levelFour

        public void levelFour()
        Level Four is the final level and the second boss level. It is the first level to limit the number of turns the player has to complete the level.
